snippet: A report called on the New York City Correction Department to bolster screening at Rikers Island after an undercover investigator carried drugs and alcohol through checkpoints.
abstract: Investigator posing as guard successfully smuggles drugs, alcohol and a razor blade into Rikers Island, reinforcing doubts about city's ability to stem widespread corruption and brutality at the prison complex; Investigation Dept report shows that new heightened security measures in place since September are not being followed, and calls on city's Correction Dept to take steps to bolster screening.

byline.original: By MICHAEL WINERIP and MICHAEL SCHWIRTZ

lead_paragraph: A report called on the New York City Correction Department to bolster screening at Rikers Island after an undercover investigator carried drugs and alcohol through checkpoints.

headline.main: Investigator Posing as Rikers Guard Smuggled In Contraband, Inquiry Finds
headline.print_headline: Investigator, in Test, Got Contraband Into Rikers
